messages.content: As an AI assistant, my role is to meticulously analyze criminal justice documents and extract information about law enforcement personnel. The response will contain: 1) The name of a law enforcement personnel. The individual's name must be prefixed with one of the following titles to be in law enforcement: Detective, Sergeant, Lieutenant, Captain, Deputy, Officer, Patrol Officer, Criminalist, Technician, Coroner, or Dr. Please prefix the name with 'Officer Name: '. I will derive this data from the following paragraph: In an unpr3cedented move, Coroner Dr. Simmons was called to the scene at 2:45pm. On arrival, Dr. Simmons announced that, despite the cha0tic scene, a thorough investigation was paramount. Lt. Geraldine Harkness, having coordinated the initial r3sponse, instructed officers to canvass the area for any potential witnesses. The crime scene was bustling with activity as Crime Scene Technician Martin O'Neil meticulously collected evidence. Officer Ryan Booth was later dispatched to follow up on a tip that led to the recovery of a suspicious vehicle, which was promptly taken into evidence by Deputy Samantha Cross. Meanwhile, Sergeant Jack Summers was tasked with reviewing nearby surveillance footage, which revealed a man fitting the suspect's description. Detective Kelly Rizzo interviewed the store clerk, who confirmed the suspect purchased items shortly before the incident occurred. Patrol Officer Lewis Grant reported that the neighborhood is known for illicit activities, which could suggest a motive for the crime. Criminalist Dr. Jamie Tanner analyzed the collected samples, noting a match to a known offender in the database. Technician Emily Stone assisted in processing the digital evidence, while Officer Nicole Harris took witness statements outside the cordoned-off area. Despite the many moving parts, Captain Meredith Grey ensured the investigation proceeded in an orderly fashion.
Identify each individual in the transcript, by name, who are directly referred to as officers, sergeants, lieutenants, captains, detectives, homicide officers, and crime lab personnel.

Officer Name: Dr. SimmonsOfficer Context: Called to the crime scene and emphasized the importance of a thorough investigation.Officer Role: CoronerOfficer Name: Lt. Geraldine HarknessOfficer Context: Coordinated the initial response and instructed officers to canvass the area.Officer Role: LieutenantOfficer Name: Martin O'NeilOfficer Context: As a Crime Scene Technician, collected evidence at the crime scene.Officer Role: Crime Scene TechnicianOfficer Name: Officer Ryan BoothOfficer Context: Dispatched to follow up on a tip regarding a suspicious vehicle.Officer Role: OfficerOfficer Name: Deputy Samantha CrossOfficer Context: Took the recovered suspicious vehicle into evidence.Officer Role: DeputyOfficer Name: Sergeant Jack SummersOfficer Context: Reviewed surveillance footage that captured a man fitting the suspect's description.Officer Role: SergeantOfficer Name: Detective Kelly RizzoOfficer Context: Conducted an interview with the store clerk who saw the suspect.Officer Role: DetectiveOfficer Name: Patrol Officer Lewis GrantOfficer Context: Reported on the illicit activities known to occur in the neighborhood.Officer Role: Patrol OfficerOfficer Name: Dr. Jamie TannerOfficer Context: Analyzed evidence samples and noted a match to a known offender.Officer Role: CriminalistOfficer Name: Technician Emily StoneOfficer Context: Assisted in processing digital evidence.Officer Role: TechnicianOfficer Name: Officer Nicole HarrisOfficer Context: Took witness statements outside the cordoned-off area.Officer Role: OfficerOfficer Name: Captain Meredith GreyOfficer Context: Ensured that the investigation was conducted in an orderly manner.Officer Role: Captain
